# Junior Research Fellow (JRF)
**Department:** Chemistry
**Vacancy:** 1
**Duration:** Initially up to 12months (extendable till the completion of project). The position is co-terminus with the project.
**Project:** Development of multifunctional copolymers-based protein-stabilized gold nanoclusters for theragnostic applications
**Location:** Hyderabad
**Fellowship:** Rs. 31,000/month
**Age limit:** 28 years (Age relaxation – the upper age limit is relax-able up to 5years in case of candidates belonging to scheduled castes/tribes/OBC, women and physically handicapped candidates.
Applications are invited for a Junior Research Fellow(JRF) position for a project funded by Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR), Department of Chemistry at Mahindra University, Hyderabad.
The selected candidate will carry out research work in the field of polymer material sciences. The prospective candidate should be an M.Sc./Integrated B.S.-M.S or equivalent degree in Chemical Sciences or relevant area, with at least 55% marks (or equivalent CGPA), and **passing of NET (LS)/GATE test.**
Interested candidates may please submit their resume at sonu.kumar@mahindrauniversity.edu.in cc to korupula.manuja@mahindrauniversity.edu.in along with soft copy of all degree certificates and **proof of NET/GATE qualification in single PDF.**
For any queries contact PI:
Dr. Sonu Kumar  
Assistant Professor  
Department of Chemistry, Ecole Centrale School of Engineering  
Mahindra University, Hyderabad.

# Junior Research Fellow Position
Applications are invited for a Junior Research Fellow position for a project funded by Ministry of Defence, at Mahindra University, Hyderabad. This is in an interdisciplinary area overlapping Numerical Simulations and Machine Learning. The prospective candidate should be an M.E / M.Tech from a reputed institution in Aerospace or Mechanical Engineering, with a good background in Computational Fluid Dynamics. Some background in Machine Learning will be a strong plus; candidates without this background will be appropriately trained on the job.
The selected candidate will be working in a Research & Development role in the area of  _Physics Informed Neural Networks_. The candidate will be encouraged to register and work concurrently towards a Ph.D. degree in an interdisciplinary area covering Fluid Dynamics and Deep Learning. The project duration is three years but the student can continue till completion of work leading to doctoral thesis. Remuneration will be at Rs. 25K per month plus free boarding and lodging at hostels in the Mahindra University campus.
The student will operate from the Ecole Centrale School of Engineering (ECSE) of Mahindra University. ECSE is the first school of the University and has research collaboration with the Ecole Centrale Group of Institutions in France. This project will provide opportunities for collaborative work with Nvidia as well as with premier Space and Defence Research Institutions in India.
Interested candidates may please submit their applications at  
_arya.bhattacharya@mahindrauniversity.edu.in_ cc to  _anil.kadali@mahindrauniversity.edu.in_

# Junior Research Fellow (JRF) for Developing an Aerial Robot for Agriculture
**Job Category:**[Research](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-category/research/)
**School:**[Mahindra University](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-type/mahindra-university/)
Applications are invited for filling up the following post of JRF for a project funded by Technology Innovation Hub on Autonomous Navigation (TiHAN) Sanctioned by DST under the National Mission on Interdisciplinary Cyber-Physical Systems (NM-ICPS). The details of the project and essential skillset required from the applicants are mentioned below.
**Description Project:**
**Development of an Autonomous Aerial Robotic System for Harvesting (AARSHa) Coconuts**. The project involves development of a multirotor (DRONE) based robotic system for harvesting. A multirotor need to be developed with necessary attachments to solve the needs of the agriculture and entire system has to tested in laboratory and real farms.
**Number of Positions** : 02
**Duration of the project** : 18 months.
**Note:** If the candidate fulfils the Institute criteria, admission in Ph.D. is considered.
**Essential qualification** : MTech in Mechanical, Mechatronics, Electronics and Communications, Robotics, embedded system. B Tech Candidates with strong knowledge of the required fields will also be considered.
**Desired Skillset:**
Experience in flying, making and testing of multirotor (DRONE).  
Experience in working on sensors, actuators and motion generation for robots.  
Programming in MATLAB & Simulink/Python/C/C++.  
Knowledge related to robot kinematics and dynamics.  
Experience in image processing and SLAM is an additional advantage.
**Salary** : CTC 4 to 5 lakhs.
**How to apply?**
Please submit your application (CV, with cover letter) to the mail ids given below. Keep the subject as “JRF application for AARSHa”)  
For more information, related to position and project please write to Dr. Janardhan V (PI of the project) (janardhan.vistapalli@mahindraunviersity.edu.in )  
For application and institute related information contact Mr. Anil Kadali (anil.kadali@mahindrauniversity.edu.in )

# Junior Research Fellow (JRF) for developing a Cyber Physical System (CPS)
**Job Category:**[Research](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-category/research/)
**School:**[Mahindra University](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-type/mahindra-university/)
Applications are invited for filling up the following post of JRF for a project funded by Mahindra University. The details of the project and essential skillset required from the applicants are mentioned below.
**Description Project:**
**Development of a Cyber Physical System for Monitoring Shop Floor Using Robots** : The project involves development of remote monitoring system using sensor fusion and Internet of Things to maintain a shop floor with machines using a single robot or cobots.
**Number of Positions** : 01  
**Duration of the project** : 2 year (extendable based performance of the candidate).
Note: If the candidate fulfils the Institute criteria, admission in Ph.D. may be considered.
**Essential qualification** : MTech in Mechanical, Mechatronics, Electronics and Communications, Robotics, B Tech students with strong fundamentals in the requires fields will also be considered.
**Desired Skillset:**
Experience in working on sensors, actuators and motion generation for robots, IoT, Cloud interfacing, experience of using Rpi.  
Programming in MATLAB & Simulink/Python/C/C++.  
Knowledge related to robot kinematics and dynamics.  
Experience in image processing and SLAM is an additional advantage.
**Salary** : CTC 4 to 5 lakhs.
**How to apply?**
Please submit your application (CV, with cover letter) to the mail ids given below. Keep the subject as “JRF application for CPS”)
For more information, related to position and project please write to Dr. Janardhan V (janardhan.vistapalli@mahindraunviersity.edu.in )
For application and institute related information contact Mr. Anil Kadali (anil.kadali@mahindrauniversity.edu.in )

# Junior Research Fellow (JRF) for Humanoid Robot Motion Generation
**Job Category:**[Research](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-category/research/)
**School:**[Mahindra University](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-type/mahindra-university/)
Applications are invited for filling up the following post of JRF for a project funded by Mahindra University. The details of the project and essential skillset required from the applicants are mentioned below.
**Description Project:**
**Trajectory Generation and Implantation on a Compliant Humanoid Robot** : The project involves development of motion trajectories for a Biped robot using MATLAB, or C/C++, and implementation of on Humanoid robot BRUCE for getting various locomotions such as walking, jumping, obstacle crossing etc.
**Number of Positions** : 01
**Duration of the project** : 2 year (extendable based performance of the candidate).
**Note:** If the candidate fulfils the Institute criteria, admission in Ph.D. may be considered.
**Essential qualification** : MTech in Mechanical, Mechatronics, Electronics and Communications, Robotics, B Tech students with strong fundamentals in the requires fields will also be considered.
**Desired Skillset:**
Embedded systems, Programming in MATLAB & Simulink/Python/C/C++.  
Knowledge related to robot kinematics and dynamics.  
Experience in image processing and SLAM is an additional advantage.
**Salary** : CTC 4 to 5 lakhs.
**How to apply?**
Please submit your application (CV, with cover letter) to the mail ids given below. Keep the subject as “JRF application for CPS”)
For more information, related to position and project please write to Dr. Janardhan V (janardhan.vistapalli@mahindraunviersity.edu.in )  
For application and institute related information contact Mr. Anil Kadali (anil.kadali@mahindrauniversity.edu.in )

# Research Associate (Postdoc) Position in SERB sponsored Project
**Job Category:**[Research](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-category/research/)
**School:**[Mahindra University](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-type/mahindra-university/)
Applications are invited for the post of **Research Associate** (RA) in a project sponsored by the Science and Engineering Research Board (SERB) under the Core Research Group (CRG) scheme entitled “**Dynamic fracture at a non-planar interface** ” (File No. CRG/2022/004550) sanctioned to Prof. Ranjith Kunnath at Mahindra University. The project involves developing mathematical formulations for dynamic fracture problems and their numerical implementation.
**Eligibility:**
Ph.D. in Mathematics/Physics/Engineering with specialization in mathematical modeling/solid mechanics and numerical methods
**Fellowship:** Upto Rs. 63,000 + 24 % HRA per month, depending on qualification and experience
**Duration:** Initial appointment is for 1 year and it can be extended depending on performance
For more information, visit the webpages [http://ranjithkunnath.in](http://ranjithkunnath.in/)/ and <https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/faculty/ranjith-kunnath>. Interested candidates can send their detailed CV and cover letter to ranjith.kunnath@mahindrauniversity.edu.in.

# Research Associate Position in ICSSR-sponsored Project
**Job Category:**[Research](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-category/research/)
**School:**[Mahindra University](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-type/mahindra-university/)
**Research Associate Position in ICSSR-sponsored Project**
Applications are invited for the post of **Research Associate** (RA) in a project sponsored by the Indian Council for Social Science Research (ICSSR) under the Major Research Project Scheme entitled “Yadadri: A Devotional Capital, Diasporic Networks and a 21st Century Telugu Identity in the Making” (File No. 02/16/2022-23/RP/MJ) sanctioned to Dr. Nisha Mathew at Mahindra University. The project is a study of the intersections of global capital, diasporic networks and religion in Hyderabad’s urban growth, concurrently as an IT hub and a devotional capital for the 21st century.
**Eligibility:**
A Masters’ degree in History, Anthropology, English Literature, Mass Communication, Cultural Studies, or any of the Social Science disciplines, with some experience in archival and ethnographic research. The candidate must have excellent communication, writing and translation skills in English and Telugu. S/he must be willing to travel within South India to conduct fieldwork and archival research.
**Fellowship:**
Candidates will be paid Rs 20,000/- a month besides travel and field expenses. The duration of the project is 2 years. Interested candidates can send their CV along with a cover letter stating details of their research experience to nisha.mathew@mahindrauniversity.edu.in.
Shortlisted candidates will be called for an interview to the campus by August 21, 2023.

# Junior Research Fellow (JRF) in SERB Sponsored Project
**Job Category:**[Research](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-category/research/)
**School:**[Mahindra University](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-type/mahindra-university/)
Applications are invited from Indian citizens for filling up the post of Junior Research Fellow (JRF) under the SERB-sponsored project for a maximum duration of three years. The position is temporary, with an initial one-year appointment, extended to three years (possibly as SRF in the third year), solely based on performance. Further, the candidate will be encouraged to apply to the regular PhD program of the institute. The details of the project are mentioned below:
**Title of the Project:** Simulation of relativistic astrophysical flow problems using modern efficient stable schemes
**Number of positions:** One (01)
**Project Duration:** Three (03) years
**Principal Investigator :** Dr. Biswarup Biswas, Mahindra University, Hyderabad
**Essential Qualifications :**
  * M.Sc. in Mathematics/Applied Mathematics or M.Tech. degree with a good knowledge of Mathematics or any equivalent degree with a minimum of 60% aggregate score.
  * Candidates are preferred with NET/GATE.
  * Desirable qualifications include proficiency in any programming language and strong communication skills.


**Age limit :** Not more than 28 years.
**Salary/Emoluments :** As per the SERB norms (**₹ 31000 per month** *).
**Relaxation on qualification and age :** SC/ST/OBC/WOMEN/PWD candidates will get relaxation as per Govt. of India rules.
**Date of Interview :** The short-listed candidates will be informed by e-mail about the interview date.
Interested candidates are requested to apply for the JRF-SERB position by emailing their comprehensive CVs to biswarup.biswas@mahindrauniversity.edu.in by September 10, 2023. The CV should include essential details such as date of birth, contact information (phone number, email, and postal address), educational and professional qualifications, and any NET/GATE qualification.

# Advertisement for the Post Doctoral Fellow
**Job Category:**[Research](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-category/research/)
**School:**[Mahindra University](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-type/mahindra-university/)
Applications are invited for the position of Post Doctoral Fellow at the Smart and Sustainable Materials Lab, Department of Civil Engineering, Ecole Centrale School of Engineering, Mahindra University for an industry funded project entitled “From Laboratory to Field: Investigating the Mechanical and Durability Behavior of Ultra High-Performance Concrete systems with Nanomaterials”. The shortlisted candidate will work with Dr. Sri Kalyana Rama Jyosyula, Prof. Visalakshi Talakokula, and Carborundum Universal Limited-Murugappa Group, Chennai. This is an excellent opportunity to work in area of nanomaterials and Ultra-high-performance concrete.
**Job Title: Post-Doctoral Fellow – Ultra High Performance Concrete**
**Department: Civil Engineering**
**Location: Hyderabad**
**Project: Smart and Sustainable Materials Lab**
**Duration** : 1 year
**Fellowship** : Rs. 57,000 p.m. + 24% HRA or 57,000 pm with food and accommodation.
**Qualifications** :
1) Ph.D. in Civil Engineering or Materials Science or a related field with a strong focus on material characterization, special concrete, and nanomaterials.
2) Strong background in experimental testing methodologies related to concrete with higher strengths.
3) Experience in laboratory-based testing, data analysis, and interpretation.
4) Excellent communication and writing skills required for research reports, publications, and presentations.
5) Ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
How to apply: Please apply with a detailed resume and appropriate cover letter to the email id below.
Contact Email ID: srikalyanarama.j@mahindrauniversity.edu.in
Application Deadline: 18/12/2023

# Research Associate at the Centre for Sustainability
**Job Category:**[Research](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-category/research/)
**School:**[Mahindra University](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-type/mahindra-university/)
**_Role_** _:_ Research Associate at the Centre for Sustainability
**_Qualification_** : Post-Graduate in Sustainability
**_Location_** : Hyderabad
Mahindra University, notified by the Government of Telangana in May 2020, is a State Private University. With 3000+ students spread across the Schools of Engineering, Management, Law, Education, and Media; the University aspires to grow to 9000+ students by 2030 with the focus being on quality higher education.
The Office of the Head – Centre for Sustainability is tasked with establishing the activities of the Centre by working with the various schools of the University and partnering with established external organizations. The tasks of the Centre include embedding sustainability in existing courses, offering electives, running executive education programs, enabling research, building a climate tech start-up ecosystem, conducting seminars and conferences, publishing cases and outreach through social media.
We need a young dynamic individual (preferably in the age band 30-35) with good interpersonal and communication skills (both oral and written). A person who is vested in enabling the success of colleagues and peers would be valued.
The person must:
  * Be able to write articles and chapters on sustainability topics
  * Be able to curate teachable courses in sustainability
  * Be able to conduct executive education programs in sustainability
  * Be able to build a multi-media library of reference materials in sustainability
  * Be able to multi-task, work independently and in a team
  * Be proficient in MS PowerPoint, Word, and Outlook.
  * Be proficient in searching the internet for information
  * Have high attention to detail and be organized
  * Work experience in a University will be a plus.


We provide an excellent work environment with remuneration as per qualifications/experience.
Interested candidates may please send their CV to: korupula.manuja@mahindrauniversity.edu.in with the **subject** as “ _Application for the position of Research Associate – Centre for Sustainability_ ”.

# Junior Research Fellow (JRF) in SERB Sponsored Project
**Job Category:**[Research](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-category/research/)
**School:**[Mahindra University](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-type/mahindra-university/)
Applications are invited from Indian citizens for filling up the post of Junior Research Fellow (JRF) under the SERB-sponsored project for a maximum duration of 3 years. The position is temporary, with an initial one-year appointment, extended to three years (possibly as SRF in the third year), solely based on performance. Further, the candidate will be encouraged to apply to the regular PhD program of the institute. The details of the project are mentioned below:
**Title of the Project :** Simulation of relativistic astrophysical flow problems using modern efficient stable schemes
**No. of position :** 1
**Project Duration :** 3 years
**Other relevant information:**
1 | Principal Investigator | Dr. Biswarup Biswas, Mahindra University, Hyderabad  
---|---|---  
2 | Essential Qualifications | M.Sc. in Mathematics/Applied Mathematics or M.Tech. degree with a good knowledge of Mathematics or any equivalent degree with a minimum of 60% aggregate score.  
Candidates are preferred with NET/GATE.  
Desirable: Knowledge of any programming language, Communication skills  
3 | Age limit | Not more than 28 years.  
4 | Salary/Emoluments | As per the SERB norms (Rs 31000/month).  
5 | Relaxation on qualification and age | SC/ST/OBC/WOMEN/PWD candidates will get relaxation as per Govt. of India rules.  
6 | Date of Interview | The short listed candidates will be informed by e-mail about the interview date.  
Interested candidates are requested to apply for the JRF-SERB position by emailing their comprehensive CVs to biswarup.biswas@mahindrauniversity.edu.in by **March 3, 2024**. The CV should include essential details such as date of birth, contact information (phone number, email, and postal address), educational and professional qualifications, and any NET/GATE qualification.

# Senior Research Fellow (SRF) – AI for Healthcare
**Job Category:**[Research](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-category/research/)
**School:**[Mahindra University](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-type/mahindra-university/)
**Position:** Senior Research Fellow (SRF)
**Number of Openings:** 1
**Project Duration:** 1 Year
**Location:** Mahindra University, Hyderabad, India
**Department:** Centre for Life Sciences
**Salary:** Rs. 42,000/ month + Hostel accommodation
**Project Funding:** IHub-Data, IIIT-Hyderabad (Established under the National Mission on Interdisciplinary Cyber Physical Systems scheme of Department of Science & Technology, Government of India).
**About Us:** Centre for Life Sciences at Mahindra University has major focus on translational research in the area of AI in Healthcare & Computational Biology. The centre is also active in advanced experimental research with groups working in the area of bio-based products/platforms development and discovery, discovery of novel biomarkers and development of efficient biosensors.
**Position Overview:** You would work on a project problem with significant impact on public health. As a member of project team, you will contribute to AI model development, validation and creation of a user-friendly web/smartphone application for real-life testing and further validation.
**Key Responsibilities:**
  * Data collection, development and validation of AI models using Retinal Fundus Images (TensorFlow/PyTorch)
  * Visiting collaborating hospitals in Hyderabad for data collection.
  * Development of web/smartphone application (Flask/ React Native/Flutter)


**Qualifications:**
BS/B.Tech/BS-MS (Dual Degree) or M.Tech having qualified CSIR-NET/GATE or selection process through national level examinations conducted by DST/DBT/DAE/DOS/DRDO/MoE/ICAR/ICMR/IIT/IISc/IISER/NISER etc. with 2-years post qualification experience.
**Required Skills:**
  * Experience in AI (deep learning/neural networks) and machine learning, preferably in healthcare domain.
  * Strong programming skills in Python, and familiarity with AI frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch etc.).
  * Experience in developing applications for web and/or smartphone integrating TensorFlow Lite/js.


**What You Will Gain:**
As a SRF, you will have the opportunity to:
  * Be part of a pioneering project with significant impact on public health.
  * Work and gain experience in application of AI in healthcare.
  * Enhance your technical skills through hands-on experience in a real-world setting.
  * Publish research papers and file patents.


**How to Apply:**
Interested candidates are invited to e-mail their applications, which should include **a CV** , the names and contact information of 1-2 referees, and a cover letter, to ** _Ms. Nirmala (Nirmala.c@mahindrauniversity.edu.in)_** via email. Please use the subject line ** _“SRF Application – Centre for Life Sciences”_**.
**For More Information:**
For inquiries related to the position and the project, please contact:
Dr. Bipin Singh: bipin.singh@mahindrauniversity.edu.in
For Institute and Application-related Information, please reach out to Mr. Anil Kadali (anil.kadali@mahindrauniversity.edu.in).
Join us in advancing the field of AI in Healthcare and making a meaningful social impact. We eagerly await the addition of passionate and dedicated individuals to our vibrant research team at Mahindra University.

# Junior Research Fellow (JRF) – Aerospace Propulsion
**Job Category:**[Research](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-category/research/)
**School:**[Mahindra University](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-type/mahindra-university/)
Applications are invited for a Junior Research Fellow (JRF) position in the Mechanical and Aerospace Eng. department of Mahindra University for a project sponsored by the Aeronautics Research and Development Board (AR&DB), DRDO.
**Project title: Design Optimization of Turbine Nozzle Guide Vane Three-Dimensional Airfoils**
**Description of the work:** You will have to carry out CFD simulations for different designs of a turbine stage (of an aircraft engine) with commercial CFD software such as ANSYS CFX. To this end, you will have to perform 3D CAD design of the turbine blades, grid generation, CFD simulations and post-processing of the results. The CFD results would be used for obtaining an optimal turbine stator vane design that minimizes aerodynamic losses. You will be working in collaboration with the Gas Turbine Research Establishment (GTRE), DRDO. The research results would be used for the design of advanced combat aircraft engine turbines.
**Required Qualifications:** The prospective candidate should have an M.E/M.Tech from a tier 1 or tier 2 institution in Mechanical or Aerospace Engineering, with a strong interest in aerospace propulsion and expertise and familiarity with CFD. Candidates with BTech degree having strong credentials will also be considered.
The JRF will be encouraged to register for a Ph.D. degree in the Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering department of Ecole Centrale School of Engineering, Mahindra University, Hyderabad.
Salary: The monthly salary is going to be Rs. 43,600 p.m. (Rs.37,000 + 18% HRA) according to the DST standards, without any deductions. However, if the candidate resides on campus, HRA will not be paid and deductions will be made towards the mess fees.
About the university: Mahindra Ecole Centrale was established in the year 2014 as a collaboration between the Mahindra Group and the prestigious Ecole Centrale Group of Institutions of France. Mahindra Ecole Centrale transformed into the full-fledged Mahindra University in the year 2020. The JRF will operate from the Ecole Centrale School of Engineering of Mahindra University. Please visit <https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/> for further details.
Project investigators: (PI) Dr. Ravi K. Bompelly, Assistant Professor, Dept. of Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering; <https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/faculty/ravikiran-bompelly>
(Co-PI) Prof. Debasis Chakraborty, Professor, Dept. of Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering <https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/debasis-chakraborty>
Interested candidates, please send your CV/resumes to ravikiran.bompelly@mahindrauniversity.edu.in at the earliest.

# Faculty Positions in Computer Science Engineering
**Job Category:**[Faculty Positions](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-category/faculty-positions/)
**School:**[Mahindra University](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-type/mahindra-university/)
**Department:**[B.Tech in Computer Science Engineering](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/department/b-tech-in-computer-science-engineering/)
**Mahindra University** invites applications for **faculty positions in Computer Science Engineering at all levels**. We seek individuals with a Ph.D. in Computer Science Engineering from reputed universities, demonstrating a strong commitment to teaching, research, and service.
Location : Hyderabad, Telangana
We are seeking accomplished and dedicated individuals with a Ph.D. in Computer Science Engineering from reputed universities to join our faculty at all levels. The ideal candidates will have a strong commitment to teaching, research, and service, and a desire to contribute to the academic and professional community.
**Responsibilities :**
  * Develop and deliver undergraduate and graduate courses in Computer Science Engineering.
  * Create and maintain course materials, including syllabi, assignments, and exams.
  * Utilize innovative teaching methods and technologies to enhance student learning.
  * Publish research findings in high-impact, peer-reviewed journals and conferences.
  * Secure research funding through grants and collaborations with industry partners.
  * Supervise and mentor graduate students and postdoctoral researchers.
  * Expertise in emerging areas of Computer Science Engineering, such as artificial intelligence, machine learning, cybersecurity, data science, or software engineering.


**Preferred Qualification :**
  * A Ph.D. in Computer Science Engineering from a reputed university.
  * Proven track record of excellence in teaching at the university level.
  * Demonstrated ability to conduct high-quality research with a record of publications.
  * Experience in securing research funding and managing research projects.


Interested candidates may please share their resumes with Umang.sharma@mahindrauniversity.edu.in with the subject line “Faculty CSE” for faculty positions in Computer Science Engineering at Mahindra University.

# Faculty Position in Electrical and Computer Engineering (Specialization in Embedded Systems, Communications Engineering, and VLSI)
**Job Category:**[Faculty Positions](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-category/faculty-positions/)
**School:**[Mahindra University](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-type/mahindra-university/)
The Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering at Mahindra University Ecole Centrale School of Engineering is looking for faculty candidates with strong research profiles and teaching expertise in **Embedded Systems, Communications Engineering, and VLSI.**
**Job Description:**
  1. **Embedded Systems** : 
     * Teaching experience in courses like Embedded Systems, Microprocessors, Internet of Things, Cyber Physical Systems, and Real-time Systems is expected.
     * Expertise in designing lab exercises for both undergraduate and postgraduate levels.
     * Candidates should demonstrate independent research through journal and conference publications.
  2. **Communications Engineering** : 
     * Specialization in wireless communication systems, 5G, error correction coding, or wireless networks is essential.
     * Teaching in areas like Signals and Systems, Digital Signal Processing, Communication Theory, and AI for Wireless Communication is required.
     * A strong research background is necessary.
  3. **VLSI** : 
     * Proficiency in areas like Digital VLSI Design, Analog Circuit Design, and System-on-Chip (SoC) architecture.
     * Experience in teaching courses such as VLSI Testing, Semiconductor Devices, and CAD for VLSI Design.
     * A proven ability to lead research in VLSI and collaborate on projects is expected.


**Required Qualification** :
  * B.Tech., M. Tech., and Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering, Electronics Engineering, Communications Engineering, Embedded Systems, and VLSI or relevant area with strong academic background from a nationally or internationally reputed institution.
  * Proof of active research through recent publications in journals of repute and conference attendance.
  * Desirable to have proof of previous funding from GoI organizations.
  * Candidates with practical experience, industry or otherwise, will be preferred.


**Additional responsibilities:** apart from teaching, the faculty members have the following responsibilities:
  * Conducting research and guiding Ph.D. students.
  * Guiding project work for undergraduate and postgraduate students.
  * To take part in various accreditation and academic auditing processes related to different programs of the department e.g. to prepare documents required for NACC, NIRF, NBA, UGC etc.
  * To take part in various administrative and academic activities of the department and university.


Interested candidates for the faculty positions in Embedded Systems, Communications Engineering, or VLSI are encouraged to share their resumes with Balaji.narayanan@mahindrauniversity.edu.in using the subject line: “ECE faculty position with your specialization area.”
For more information please visit: <https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/careers/>

# Faculty in School of Design Innovation
**Job Category:**[Faculty Positions](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-category/faculty-positions/)
**School:**[Mahindra University](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-type/mahindra-university/)
**Department:**[School of Design Innovation](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/department/school-of-design-innovation/)
Join Mahindra University as the founding Faculty in the **School of Design Innovation**
Mahindra University is seeking a committed and passionate designer for all streams of design at Assistant Professor, Associate Professor, and Professor levels. We are looking for ideal candidates who are eager to create a paradigm shift in design pedagogy, facilitate dynamic career paths for students, and prepare them for the ever-evolving technological landscape and assist in teaching B Des, M Des, and Ph.D. programs.
**Responsibilities include:**
  * Conducting advanced research in Design Innovation.
  * Teaching and mentoring students in B Des, M Des, and Ph.D. programs.
  * Developing and delivering innovative curriculum and courses.
  * Collaborating with industry partners and partnering with faculty of all disciplines in the University.
  * Publishing research findings in reputed journals and conferences.


**Qualifications:**
  * Three to five years design practice in industry or consulting firms.
  * Ph.D. in Design Innovation or a related field.
  * Interested in research with focus on design pedagogy and innovation.
  * Passionate about teaching and mentoring students.
  * Ability to work collaboratively in a multidisciplinary environment.
  * Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.


Interested candidates are invited to share their resumes with Anil.kadali@mahindrauniversity.edu.in with the subject line “School of Design Innovation.”
For more information, please visit our website at <https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/>.

# Senior Research Fellow (SRF)
**Job Category:**[Research](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-category/research/)
**School:**[Mahindra University](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-type/mahindra-university/)
**Position:**
**Number of Openings:**
**Project Duration:**
**Location:**
**Department:**
**Salary:**
**Project Funding:**
**About Us:**
**Position Overview:**
**Key Responsibilities:**
  * Data collection, development and validation of AI models using Retinal Fundus Images (TensorFlow/PyTorch)
  * Visiting collaborating hospitals in Hyderabad for data collection.
  * Development of web/smartphone applications (Flask/ React Native/Flutter)


**Qualifications:**
BS/B.Tech/BS-MS (Dual Degree) or M.Tech having qualified CSIR-NET/GATE or selection process through national level examinations conducted by DST/DBT/DAE/DOS/DRDO/MoE/ICAR/ICMR/IIT/IISc/IISER/NISER etc. with 2-years post qualification experience.
**Required Skills:**
  * Experience in AI (deep learning/neural networks) and machine learning, preferably in the healthcare domain.
  * Strong programming skills in Python, and familiarity with AI frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch etc.).
  * Experience in developing applications for web and/or smartphone integrating TensorFlow Lite/TensorFlow.js.


**What You Will Gain:**
As a SRF, you will have the opportunity to:
  * Be part of a pioneering project with a significant impact on public health.
  * Work and gain experience in the application of AI in healthcare.
  * Enhance your technical skills through hands-on experience in a real-world setting.
  * Publish research papers and file patents.


**How to Apply:**
Interested candidates are invited to e-mail their applications, which should include**a CV** , the names and contact information of 1-2 referees, and a cover letter, to**Ms. Umang (umang.sharma@mahindrauniversity.edu.in)****“SRF Application – Centre for Life Sciences”**.
**For inquiries related to the position and the project, please contact:**
Dr. Bipin Singh: bipin.singh@mahindrauniversity.edu.in
Join us in advancing the field of AI in Healthcare and making a meaningful social impact. We eagerly await the addition of passionate and dedicated individuals to our vibrant research team at Mahindra University.

# Junior Research Fellow (JRF)
**Job Category:**[Research](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-category/research/)
**School:**[Mahindra University](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-type/mahindra-university/)
**Junior Research Fellow (JRF)**
**No. of Position: 1**
**Area: Solid Propellant Combustion Modeling**
**Department: Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering**
**About Mahindra University:**
Mahindra University is established under Telangana State Private University Act in 2020. The University has developed a well-designed curriculum for each program that shows light towards a bright future of its students. The interactive curriculum and high quality education offered by MU has created an impact of being a well-honoured educational institute amongst its peers. To know more about Mahindra University, it is advised to visit website [www.mahindrauniversty.edu.in](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/).
**About Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering Department:**
The Department of Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering is very active in the key areas of design, manufacturing, robotics, thermal engineering, solid propellant combustion modelling with significant research programs and facilities. The department runs three undergraduate programs (B.Tech.) in Mechanical, Mechatronics and Aerospace Engineering; three postgraduate (M.Tech.) programs in Robotics, Computational Mechanics and Systems Engineering along with Ph.D. program.
**About the Research Grant:**
Very Recently, the department has received a research grant from **Ministry of Défense** to conduct the cutting-edge research in the area of **heterogeneous solid propellant combustion modelling**. The research will be jointly carried out with the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Bombay. The duration of the research grant is for **three years** and likely to be extended further. The department is seeking applications from eligible candidates for **Junior Research Fellow (JRF)** for carrying out research under this research grant. The candidates will be selected based on personal interview.
**Qualification**
  * B.Tech/M.Tech in Mechanical/Aerospace Engineering.
  * Candidates should have programming skills.
  * Candidates should have good research aptitudes
  * Candidates are encouraged to pursue their Ph.D.


**Job Description:**
  * Will conduct research in solid propellant combustion modelling under the supervision of the project investigators.


**Salary:**
  * At the present rate, JRF’s will be paid a monthly remuneration of Rs. 37000 with 16% HRA, totaling Rs. 42920 p.m. After two years the JRF will be considered as Senior Research Fellow (SRF) and will be paid Rs. 48720 with 16% HRA.


Interested candidates may please share their **CV** by 31st October, 2024 to either Nirmala.c@mahindrauniversity.edu.in or debasis.chakraborty@mahindrauniversity.edu.in with email subject as: “**JRF for Solid Propellant combustion modelling”.**

# Faculty position in Structural Engineering
**Job Category:**[Faculty Positions](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-category/faculty-positions/)
**School:**[Mahindra University](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-type/mahindra-university/)
Mahindra University Invites applications for the **Faculty position in** **Structural Engineering** :
Department: Civil Engineering  
Duration: Full time  
Location: Hyderabad, Telangana.
**Basic Qualifications:**  
Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering with a minimum first class or equivalent.  
Master’s and Ph.D. in Structural Engineering.
**Required / Desirable skills:**
  1. The candidate is expected to teach undergraduate and postgraduate courses in the relevant discipline
  2. Must have demonstrated interest in any one of the specific areas mentioned below as evidenced by publications in peer-reviewed journals
  3. Expected to work on evolving curriculum and establish laboratories as necessary.
  4. Should be interested in writing research projects and collaborating with industry partners.


**Required expertise areas:**
  * Computational Mechanics
  * AI and ML Applications in Structural Engineering
  * Expertise in the design, analysis, and behavior of steel structures.
  * Fire Engineering, including fire-resistant materials, structural response to fire, and safety consideration.


Interested candidates are encouraged to submit their CVs to Nirmala.c@mahindrauniversity.edu.in with the **subject: “** Faculty position in Structural Engineering”

# Junior Research Fellow (JRF) – Nanomedicine in Cancer Theranostics
**Job Category:**[Research](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-category/research/)
**School:**[Mahindra University](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-type/mahindra-university/)
**Position:** Junior Research Fellow (JRF)
**Number of Openings:** 1
**Project Duration:** 1 Year
**Location:** Mahindra University, Hyderabad, India
**Department:** Centre for Life Sciences
**Project Funding:** SERB – POWER (Promoting Opportunities For Women in Exploratory Research scheme of Department of Science & Technology, Government of India).
**About Us:** Centre for Life Sciences and Interdisciplinary Centre for Nanosensors and Nanomedicine at Mahindra University have major focus towards translational research. The centre is also active in advanced experimental research with groups working in the area of bio-based products/platforms development, discovery of novel biomarkers and development of efficient biosensors.
**Position Overview:** You would work on a project problem with significant impact on public health. As a member of project team, you will contribute to Biodots and Carbon Quantum Dots synthesis, nanoparticle formulation and characterization, cell culture-based 2D and 3D evaluation and further validation.
**Key Responsibilities:**
  * Cell Culture
  * Nanoparticle preparation and characterization
  * Visiting collaborating hospitals in Hyderabad for patient sample collection
  * Nanoparticle evaluation in 2D and 3D cell culture and patient’s cancer sample


**Qualifications:**
BS/B.Tech/BS-MS (Dual Degree) or M.Tech. having qualified CSIR-NET/GATE or selection process through national level examinations conducted by DST/DBT/ICMR/IIT/IISc/IISER/ NIPER etc.
**Required Skills:**
  * Experience in cell culture
  * Basic understanding of Biochemistry and Cell and Molecular Biology


**What You Will Gain:**  
As a JRF, you will have the opportunity to:
  * Synthesize and characterize nanoparticles
  * _In vitro_ evaluation of nanoparticles on cell lines and patient-derived samples
  * Publish research papers and file patents


**How to Apply:**  
Interested candidates are invited to e-mail their applications until **22 nd November 2024**, which should include **a CV** , the names and contact information of 1-2 referees, and a cover letter, to ** _Ms. Nirmala (Nirmala.c@mahindrauniversity.edu.in)_** via email. Please use the subject line ** _“JRF Application – Centre for Life Sciences”_**.
**For More Information:**  
For inquiries related to the position and the project, please contact:  
Dr. Manu Smriti Singh: manu.singh@mahindrauniversity.edu.in  
For Institute and Application-related Information, please reach out to Mr. Anil Kadali (anil.kadali@mahindrauniversity.edu.in).  
Join us in advancing the field of Nanomedicine in Cancer Theranostics and making a meaningful social impact. We eagerly await the addition of passionate and dedicated individuals to our vibrant research team at Mahindra University.

# Centre for Entrepreneurship and Innovation (CEI)
**Job Category:**[Faculty Positions](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-category/faculty-positions/)
**School:**[Mahindra University](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-type/mahindra-university/)
We are inviting applications for a faculty position in the**Centre for Entrepreneurship and Innovation (CEI)** at **Mahindra University** , Hyderabad.
The Centre for Entrepreneurship and Innovation is an interdisciplinary Centre that serves all schools of the University. Its core mandate is to fulfil the university’s mission by balancing education with experience through entrepreneurial projects that aim to solve society’s complex challenges. As a member of the prestigious Babson College Collaborative, the centre seeks to create pathways to entrepreneurship by providing students, alums, and faculty with the skills, tools, and mindset required to be enterprising.
In addition to offering various entrepreneurship courses within the existing programs, CEI is launching a BBA in Entrepreneurship & Family Business Management for the Academic Year 2025.
**Job Description:**
Research & Publication:
  * Conducted entrepreneurship research and published it in peer-reviewed journals.
  * Secure external funding and collaborate on interdisciplinary research projects.


Teaching & Curriculum Development:
  * Develop and teach entrepreneurship and innovation courses (e.g., tech entrepreneurship, entrepreneurial finance, lean methodology).
  * Use experiential pedagogies and mentor students.


Mentorship & Leadership:
  * Mentor graduate students and junior faculty, guiding research and professional growth.
  * Contribute to the development of the entrepreneurship program.


Outreach & Professional Development:
  * Engage with the local entrepreneurial ecosystem and participate in university committees.
  * Stay current with trends by attending events and building a professional network.


**Required Qualification:**
  * Ph.D. in Entrepreneurship, Business Administration, or related field (or extensive relevant experience for Practice positions).
  * Strong research record with significant publications in reputable journals.
  * Proven success in securing external research funding and grants.
  * Excellence in teaching with experience in curriculum development and innovative pedagogical methods.
  * Commitment to mentoring students and leadership in collaborative academic environments.
  * Effective communication skills and the ability to engage with external stakeholders in the entrepreneurial ecosystem.


Interested candidates may please share their detailed CVs with Nirmala.c@mahindrauniversity.edu.in with the subject as an ** _application for CEI._**

# Professor of Practice – Construction Planning and Management
**Job Category:**[Faculty Positions](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-category/faculty-positions/)
**School:**[Mahindra University](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-type/mahindra-university/)
**Position Title:** Professor of Practice – Construction Planning and Management  
**Department:** Civil Engineering  
**Institution:** Mahindra University  
**Location:** Hyderabad, Telangana
**Overview:**  
Mahindra University’s Civil Engineering Department is seeking a highly experienced professional to join as a **Professor of Practice** specializing in **Construction Planning and Management.** This position focuses on leveraging extensive industry expertise to contribute to academic excellence, including teaching, mentoring, and fostering research activities.
**Responsibilities:**
  * Deliver specialized courses in Construction Planning and Management, focusing on practical applications and industry relevance.
  * Establish strong linkages with the construction industry to align academic outcomes with practical requirements.
  * Guide students in applied research projects, internships, and real-world problem-solving.
  * Provide academic and career mentoring to undergraduate and postgraduate students.
  * Work collaboratively with faculty and staff to drive research output and innovative teaching practices.
  * Strong knowledge and practical experience in **Construction Planning and Management.**


**Educational Qualifications:**
  * Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering, Master’s degree in Construction Planning and Management.
  * D. is desirable but not mandatory.


Minimum **10 years of industry experience** in the construction sector, with demonstrated expertise in construction planning, project management, and execution.
Interested candidates are encouraged to apply by submitting their application to Balaji.narayanan@mahindrauniversity.edu.in with the subject line: _Application for Professor of Practice – CPM._

# Junior Research Fellow (JRF)
Applications are invited for filling up the following post of JRF for a project funded by Mahindra University. The details of the project and essential skillset required from the applicants are mentioned below.
**Description Project:**
**Development of an Autonomous Aerial Robotic System for Harvesting (AARSHa)**. The project involves development of a multirotor (DRONE) based robotic system for harvesting. A multirotor need to be developed with necessary attachments to solve the needs of the agriculture and entire system has to tested in laboratory and real farms.
**Number of Positions:** 01
**Duration of the project:** 1 year (extendable based performance of the candidate).
Note: If the candidate fulfils the Institute criteria, admission in Ph.D. may be considered.
**Essential qualification:** MTech in Mechanical, Mechatronics, Electronics and Communications, Robotics.
**Desired Skillset:**
Experience in flying, making and testing of multirotor (DRONE).
Experience in working on sensors, actuators and motion generation for robots.
Programming in MATLAB & Simulink/Python/C/C++.
Knowledge related to robot kinematics and dynamics.
Experience in image processing and SLAM is an additional advantage.
**Salary:** As per norms of Mahindra University.
**How to apply?**
Please submit your application (CV, with cover letter) to the mail ids given below. Keep the subject as “JRF application for AARSHa”)
For more information, related to position and project please write to Dr. Janardhan V (janardhan.vistapalli@mahindraunviersity.edu.in )
For application and institute related information contact Mr. Anil Kadali (anil.kadali@mahindrauniversity.edu.in)

# Junior Research Fellow (JRF)
**Job Category:**[Research](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-category/research/)
**School:**[Mahindra University](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-type/mahindra-university/)
**_Junior Research Fellow (JRF) – Soft Exoskeleton Development_**
**Position:** Junior Research Fellow (JRF)
**Number of Openings:** 2
**Project Duration:** 1 Year
**Location:** Mahindra University, Hyderabad, India
**Department:** Ecole Centrale School of Engineering – Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering
**Salary:** Competitive, in line with Government of India (GOI) Standards
**Project Funding:** Funded by IHFC IIT Delhi, through the Government of India’s Department of Science and Technology (DST)
**About Us:**
Mahindra University’s Centre for Robotics, located in Hyderabad, India, is a hub of innovation in advanced robotics research. We are embarking on an exciting project, supported by IHFC IIT Delhi and the Government of India’s DST, with the goal of developing a cutting-edge soft exoskeleton for upper limb rehabilitation and daily assistance.
**Position Overview:**
We are in search of two motivated Junior Research Fellows (JRF) to become part of our dynamic team. As a JRF, you will be at the forefront of innovative research in soft exoskeleton development. Your role will involve designing, developing, and implementing novel control strategies for upper limb rehabilitation, with a specific emphasis on the hand and elbow joints. Collaboration with clinical partners and the use of rapid prototyping techniques will be essential components of your work.
**Key Responsibilities:**
  * Create and fabricate a wearable soft exoskeleton, prioritizing user mobility while maintaining compatibility with the human limb.
  * Contribute to the development of a robust control architecture for the exoskeleton, enabling targeted motion assistance.
  * Investigate a range of control strategies, including force and velocity fields, admittance and impedance control, and resistive and assistive fields in three-dimensional space.


**Qualifications and Skills:**
**Qualifications:**
  1. Tech degree with a background or expertise in Robotics, Mechatronics, Controls, Electronics, or Mechanical Engineering.


**Required Skills:**
  * Proficiency in C++, Python, and Embedded C.
  * Experience with AutoDesk Inventor or CATIA.
  * Hands-on experience with hardware platforms such as Nvidia Jetson Nano, Raspberry Pi, Arduino, etc.
  * Familiarity with Matlab, Simulink, Simscape, and similar toolboxes.
  * Strong knowledge of robot control and programming.
  * Previous hands-on experience in building robotic systems, signal processing, EMG sensors


**Desired Skills (a plus):**
  * Strong proficiency in the English language.
  * Prior experience with torque sensors.
  * Familiarity with exoskeleton devices.
  * Understanding of human biomechanics.
  * A track record of publications showcasing expertise in the field or relevant industrial experience.


**What You Will Gain:**
As a JRF, you will have the opportunity to:
  * Independently design and analyze control requirements for complex upper limb exoskeletons.
  * Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams and clinicians, gaining invaluable real-world experience.
  * Contribute to pushing the boundaries of current technology, surpassing the capabilities of existing devices in the field.
  * Possibility to covert to PhD position (deserving candidates)


**How to Apply:**
Interested candidates are invited to e-mail their applications, which should include a **CV** , the names and contact information of two referees, and a cover letter, to _Mr. Anil Kadali (anil.kadali@mahindrauniversity.edu.in )_ via email. Please use the subject line **_“JRF Application – IHFC Robotics”_** when applying.
**For More Information:**
For inquiries related to the position and the project, please contact:
Dr. Deep Seth (Deep.Seth@mahindrauniversity.edu.in)  
Dr. Sanjeevi Nakka (Sanjeevi.nakka@mahindrauniversity.edu.in)
For Institute and Application-related Information, please reach out to Mr. Anil Kadali (anil.kadali@mahindrauniversity.edu.in).
Join us in advancing the field of robotics and making a meaningful impact in the realms of rehabilitation and assistive technology. We eagerly await the addition of passionate and dedicated individuals to our vibrant research team at Mahindra University.

# Advertisement for the Junior Research Fellow (JRF) Position in Aerial Robotics – Autonomous Drones with Digital Twin Technology
**Job Category:**[Research](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-category/research/)
**School:**[Mahindra University](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-type/mahindra-university/)
Applications are invited for the position of Junior Research Fellow (JRF) in the research project focused on Aerial Robotics, Autonomous Drones, and Digital Twin Technology at Mahindra University. The project aims to integrate digital twin technology with autonomous drone systems.
**Job Description:**
The JRF will be involved in the development, simulation, and testing of autonomous drone systems integrated with digital twin technology. Key responsibilities will include:
  * Designing and developing autonomous drone systems.
  * Integrating digital twin models for real-time simulation and monitoring of drone performance.
  * Developing algorithms for autonomous navigation, path planning, and obstacle avoidance.
  * Implementing sensor fusion and real-time decision-making systems for drone autonomy.
  * Conducting field testing to validate digital twin models and optimize system performance.
  * Collaborating with a research team and contributing to publications, project reports, and presentations.


Number of Positions: 01  
Project Duration: 1 year (extendable based on the candidate’s performance)  
**Note:** If the candidate fulfills the institute’s criteria, admission to the Ph.D. program may be considered.  
Essential Qualifications:
  * M.Tech in Mechanical Engineering, Mechatronics, Electronics and Communications, Robotics, or a related field.
  * B.Tech candidates with a solid foundation in the relevant fields may also be considered.
  * Familiarity with aerial robotics, autonomous drone systems, and digital twin technology is desirable.


Skills Required:
  * Strong programming skills (Python, C++, MATLAB).
  * Experience with robotics platforms (ROS, ISSAC), drone control systems, and sensor integration.
  * Familiarity with digital twin technology, simulation tools (Gazebo, MATLAB, UNITY), and drone navigation algorithms.
  * Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills for system optimization and troubleshooting.


Salary: CTC 4 to 5 lakhs per annum
**How to Apply:**
Interested candidates should submit their CV along with a cover letter via email to the addresses provided below. Please mention the subject line as: “JRF Application for CPS”.
For further information related to the position and project, please contact:  
Dr. Janardhan V (**janardhan.vistapalli@mahindraunviersity.edu.in** )
For queries related to the application process and institute information, please contact:  
Mr. Anil Kadali (**anil.kadali@mahindrauniversity.edu.in** )

# Junior Research Fellow (JRF)
**Job Category:**[Research](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-category/research/)
**School:**[Mahindra University](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-type/mahindra-university/)
Application are invited from Indian national candidates for the position of **Junior Research Fellow (JRF)** for a temporary period (purely on contractual basis) in a time bound sponsored research project by **Anusandhan National Research Foundation (ANRF), Government of India** under the supervision of Dr. Sonu Kumar, Department of Chemistry, Mahindra University, Hyderabad, as per the following details.  
---  
**Position** | Junior Research Fellow (JRF)  
**Number of Vacancy** | 01  
**Fellowship** |  **Rs. 37,000/-** per month (as per ANRF norms)  
**Project Title** | Development of synthetic polymer-based ink materials as an alternative for 3D printing  
**Department** | Department of Chemistry  
**Location** | Hyderabad  
**Tenure** | Initial appointment for 1 year (with a possibility of extension for 1 year or till the completion of project, solely based on candidate’s performance).  
**The position is co-terminus with the project.**  
**Job Description** | To carry out the research work in the field of polymer material sciences  
**Essential Qualification** | M.Sc. or equivalent degree in Chemical Sciences or relevant area, with at least 55% marks (or equivalent CGPA), and qualification in **CSIR-UGC NET (including LS)/GATE** /equivalent national level examination.  
**Desirable Qualification** | Candidate having research experience in synthetic organic chemistry/polymer material sciences will be preferred  
**Upper Age Limit** |  **28 Years**(Age relaxation for SC/ST/OBC and PWD candidates is applicable as per Government of India norms)  
**Date of interview:** Shortlisted candidates will be informed by e-mail about the interview date.
**Application Procedure:**
  * Interested candidates may visit at: <https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/career-services> and further submit their **resume at**kumar@mahindrauniversity.edu.in cc to nirmala.c@mahindrauniversity.edu.in along with the soft copy of all degree certificates and **proof of NET/GATE qualification in a single pdf**.


**For any queries contact PI:**  
Dr. Sonu Kumar Assistant Professor  
Department of Chemistry, École Centrale School of Engineering Mahindra University, Hyderabad-500043
Email: sonu.kumar@mahindrauniversity.edu.in  
Webpage: <https://sites.google.com/view/s-kumar/home>

# Apple Lab Technician
**Job Category:**[Lab Technician](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-category/lab-technician/)
**School:**[Mahindra University](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-type/mahindra-university/)
Mahindra University is seeking a dedicated “**Apple Lab Technician****”** to oversee the daily operations of the **Apple lab****.** This role focuses on supporting students and faculty with Apple technology, managing lab resources, and fostering a smooth digital learning environment.
**Job Description:**
  * Software Assistance: Provide hands-on support for lab users with Apple’s media creation software, such as Final Cut Pro, iMovie, GarageBand, Logic Pro, and Motion. Guide users in editing video, creating audio projects, and troubleshooting software issues such as crashes, file errors, or missing codecs.
  * User Guidance: Help users with media file management, including importing/exporting files, file conversions, and backup processes. Ensure users understand how to use various tools effectively for their creative projects.
  * Assist students and faculty with Apple system usage, including navigation macOS, iOS, and essential software like Final Cut Pro, Logic Pro, and Keynote.
  * Provide one-on-one or group support to help students in using Apple devices.
  * Basic hands on understanding of hardware and software.
  * Basic knowledge of macOS, iOS, and Apple hardware
  * Required Knowledge on Apple system configuration and storage management
  * Assist in organizing workshops and training sessions on Apple technology for students and staff
  * Guide users on best practices for file management, cloud storage, and collaboration tools.
  * Ensure lab equipment is organized, clean, and ready for use.
  * Maintain an inventory of devices and accessories, and monitor system performance, and report any technical issues to the IT department
  * Maintain an updated record of lab schedules, software versions, and user activity.
  * Some understanding of media technology would be an added advantage.


Interested candidates may please share their CVs at Umang.sharma@mahindrauniversity.edu.in with the subject as “Application for the position of “Apple Lab Technician”.

# Faculty Position: Management Information Systems (MIS)
**Job Category:**[Faculty Positions](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-category/faculty-positions/)
**School:**[Mahindra University](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-type/mahindra-university/)
Mahindra University invites applications for a faculty position in the area of Management Information Systems at the School of Management.
Faculty Position: Management Information Systems (MIS)
Location: Hyderabad, Telangana.
We welcome applications from late-stage PhD candidates, pre-submission PhD students, and recent PhD graduates passionate about research, teaching, and academic community-building.
**Key Teaching Areas:**
  * Management Information Systems
  * Data Visualization and Python
  * Big Data and Cloud Computing
  * E-Commerce and Digital Strategy


We are looking for scholars who combine rigor in research with a passion for teaching in a vibrant, interdisciplinary environment.
Interested candidates, may please share their resumes with Anil.kadali@mahindrauniversity.edu.in with the subject line: “Application for MIS”

# Hiring for PDF and JRF at MU-Virginia Tech Projects
**Job Category:**[Research](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-category/research/)
**School:**[Mahindra University](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/job-type/mahindra-university/)
Mahindra University in collaboration with Virginia Tech have jointly launched an Interdisciplinary Advanced Research Center for Transformative Technologies (I2T2) at Mahindra University, Hyderabad campus.
These roles are part of high-impact, internally funded research projects aimed at driving innovation in the following transformative areas:
  * Biomarkers Discovery: Early Detection & Biotherapeutics
  * Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
  * Energy & Water Nexus


**Project 1: Biomarkers Discovery: Early Detection & Biotherapeutics:**
Project 1  
Research topic: Biomarker Discovery and Validation for Early Detection of Head and Neck Cancers.  
Position: Postdoctoral Fellow (PDF)  
Duration: 2 years (Initial appointment for 1 year, extendable based on performance)  
Project Guide: Dr. Arun Kumar Chelluboyina
**Job Description:** The selected Postdoctoral Fellow will work on a translational cancer research project aimed at identifying and validating molecular biomarkers for early diagnosis of head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC).  
**Roles & Responsibilities:**
  * Designing and executing molecular experiments including RNA sequencing, RT-qPCR, proteomics, and ELISA-based assays.
  * Performing data analysis using bioinformatics tools to identify differentially expressed biomarkers.
  * Handling clinical samples in collaboration with hospital partners and maintaining biospecimen integrity.
  * Writing reports, publications, and assisting in drafting grant proposals.
  * Coordinating with collaborating institutions and assisting in pilot diagnostic assay development.


Additional Benefits: Travel support for conferences and access to high-end instrumentation.
Interested candidates please share your CVs with anagha.subhash@mahindrauniversity.edu.in with the subject line as research topic – Biomarkers Discovery**.**
**Project 2: Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning**
  
Research topic: Intersection of IoT-based real-time monitoring of power substations and blackout prediction in smart grids using deep learning techniques.  
Position: Junior Research Fellow (JRF)  
Duration: 2 years (Initial appointment for 1 year, extendable based on performance)  
Project Guide: Dr. Neeraj Choudhary
**Job Description:**
  * The selected candidate will contribute to an interdisciplinary project focused on IoT-enabled smart grid monitoring using Raspberry Pi-based edge computing and deep learning for blackout prediction.
  * Key responsibilities include sensor integration, real-time data acquisition, model development, and dashboard implementation.
  * Candidates with experience in Python, IoT systems, and machine learning are preferred.


Project 2  
**Research topic:** Physics Informed ML – RVDS-LSUM Scheme for analysis and design of complex Aerospace configurations  
Position: Postdoctoral Fellow (PDF)  
Duration: 2 years (Initial appointment for 1 year, extendable based on performance)  
Project Guide: Prof. Arya Kumar Bhattacharya
**Job Description:**
  * To advance the LSKUM-RVDS-ELM methodology to the design and optimization of complex Aerospace configurations using the inviscid Euler equations for transonic regimes.
  * This methodology belongs to the domain of Physics-Informed Machine Learning, here LSKUM denotes Least Square Kinetic Upwind Method (refer works of SM Deshpande et al), and preliminary description of RVDS (Residual Variation Diminishing Scheme) and ELM (Extreme Learning Machine) may be found at [10.1109/ACCESS.2024.3457670](https://doi.org/10.1109/access.2024.3457670) .
  * Further extension of the methodology to low supersonic speeds and also RANS approaches are envisaged.
  * The candidate should have completed Doctoral work in the area of CFD, have some appreciation of AI / ML including optimization techniques, and have good software development skills.
  * Should have orientation to work in a team and a fair record of quality published work.


Project 3  
**Research topic:** Quantum generative methods for metasurface-based single photon emissions  
Position: Postdoctoral Fellow (PDF)  
Duration: 2 years (Initial appointment for 1 year, extendable based on performance)  
Project Guide: Prof. Jayasri D
**Job Description:**
  * To carry out independent research in the field of inverse design using quantum algorithms and perform implementations in languages such as python/C.
  * To use IBM and/or Xanadu platforms for quantum methods and integrate them with the classical ML methods.
  * To independently work on IP creation such as patents and publications and also collaborate with the existing team of researchers.


Interested candidates please share your CVs with balaji.narayanan@mahindrauniversity.edu.in with the subject line as research topic – AI&ML
**Project 3: Energy & Water Nexus**  
MUVT – IARCT2 at Mahindra University invites applications from highly motivated candidates for a Postdoctoral Researcher position in the area of two-dimensional (2D) materials for next-generation energy storage and sensor technologies.
  
**Research topic:** 2D Materials for Next-Generation Energy Storage and Sensor Technologies  
Position: Postdoctoral Fellow (PDF)  
Duration: 2 years (Initial appointment for 1 year, extendable based on performance)  
Project Guide: Dr. Chitra Gurnani
**Job Description:**
  * The successful candidate will contribute to interdisciplinary research team working developing high-performance materials and devices for energy storage (batteries, supercapacitors) and sensors.


  * Design and synthesis of novel 2D materials, including chalcogenides, carbides, heterostructures
  * Characterization using advanced techniques (IR, NMR, UV, XRD, SEM, TEM, Raman, XPS, AFM, etc.)
  * Fabrication and testing of energy storage devices (e.g., supercapacitors, Li-ion, Na-ion) and sensors
  * Data analysis and prepare manuscripts for publication in peer-reviewed journals and contribute to research proposals.
  * Present research findings at group meetings, conferences, and symposia.


**Essential Qualifications:**
  * Ph.D. in Chemistry, Materials Science, Nanotechnology, or a closely related field
  * Expertise in 2D materials synthesis (CVD, solution-based)
  * Experience in electrochemical testing (CV, GCD, EIS) and materials characterization
  * Track record of peer-reviewed publications
  * Ability to work independently and in a team-oriented, interdisciplinary environment


**Desirable:**
  * Experience with device integration or flexible/wearable electronics


**Additional Benefits:**
  * Travel support for conferences


Project 2  
**Research topic:** Design and Synthesis of Advanced Materials for Electrocatalytic and Photocatalytic applications.  
Position: Postdoctoral Fellow (PDF)  
Duration: 2 years (Initial appointment for 1 year, extendable based on performance)  
Project Guide: Dr. Gomathi Anandhanatarajan
**Job Description:**
  * The successful candidate will contribute to the development and mechanistic understanding of advanced catalytic materials.
  * Design, synthesize, and characterize novel catalytic materials (e.g., metal oxides, chalcogenides, molecular complexes and graphene-based nanocomposites).
  * Conduct electrochemical and photoelectrochemical experiments to evaluate catalytic performance.
  * Employ techniques such as CV, LSV, EIS, and chronoamperometry.
  * Analyze structure–activity relationships using advanced characterization tools (XRD, TEM, XPS, SEM, UV-Vis, etc.).
  * Prepare manuscripts for publication in peer-reviewed journals and contribute to research proposals.
  * Present research findings at group meetings, conferences, and symposia.


**Essential Qualifications**
  * Ph.D. in Chemistry, Materials Science, Nanotechnology, or a closely related field
  * Track record of peer-reviewed publications
  * Ability to work independently and in a team-oriented, interdisciplinary environment


**Additional Benefits:**
  * Travel support for conferences


Interested candidates please share your CVs with Nirmala.c@mahindraunviversity.edu.in with the subject line as research topic – Energy & Water Nexus
